page.title: 03MINING
page.content:
The Wheal Eliza mine first opened in the sixteenth century that the greatest efforts were made to extract the iron ore.The Wheal Eliza,in the Barle Valley about one mile south of Simonsbath,was developed by Frederick Knight.He spent a great deal of money on the mine and on preparing the route for a railway to transport the ore to Porlock Weir. Knight began work in 1856 but two years later he was forced to abandon the project.
In 1985 the ruined buildings at the mine can clearly be seen and the waste of the mine clearly shows traces of iron ore.
